com.pkrete.xrd4j.common.message

Class ServiceResponse<T1,T2>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pkrete.xrd4j.common.message.AbstractMessage
      • com.pkrete.xrd4j.common.message.ServiceResponse<T1,T2>
  • Type Parameters:
    T1 - runtime type of the request data
    T2 - runtime type of the response data
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ServiceResponse<T1,T2>
extends AbstractMessage
implements Serializable
    This class represents X-Road service response message that is sent by a ProviderMember and received by a ConsumerMember. ServiceResponse message is always sent as a response to ServiceRequest message.
    Author:
    Petteri Kivim√§ki
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ServiceResponse

        public ServiceResponse(ConsumerMember consumer,
               ProducerMember producer,
               String id)
                throws XRd4JException
        Constructs and initializes a new ServiceResponse object.
        Parameters:
        consumer - client that's calling a service
        producer - service provider whose service the client is calling
        id - unique identifier of the message
        Throws:
        XRd4JException - if there's a XRd4J error

    • Method Detail

      • getRequestHash

        public String getRequestHash()
        Returns the hash of the SOAP request message. The value is set by service provider's security server.
        Returns:
        hash of the SOAP request message

      • setRequestHash

        public void setRequestHash(String requestHash)
        Sets the hash of the SOAP request message. The value is set by service provider's security server.

      • getRequestData

        public T1 getRequestData()
        Returns the request data that's received from the client. This data is used as input for generating the response.
        Returns:
        request data that's received from the client
